title: Global SEO defaults, indexing configuration, and header logo branding update

requirements.summary: Set global SEO meta title/description to the requested exact values and ensure the homepage does not override them.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/lib/siteConfig.ts` is updated so the default SEO title resolves to exactly "H★S Online Earn Platform | Md. Habibur Rahman".

`frontend/src/lib/siteConfig.ts` is updated so the default SEO description resolves to exactly "Join H★S Online Earn Platform for easy online typing and data entry jobs. Start earning today with free training from Md. Habibur Rahman.".
The homepage (route "/") uses the global title/description (i.e., it does not render a conflicting per-page title/description that overrides the requested global values).

file_operations.description: Update the exported siteConfig so `name` (global SEO title base) is exactly "H★S Online Earn Platform | Md. Habibur Rahman" and `description` is exactly "Join H★S Online Earn Platform for easy online typing and data entry jobs. Start earning today with free training from Md. Habibur Rahman.".
Update the HomePage `<Seo />` usage to rely on global defaults (remove per-page title/description overrides) while keeping `path="/"` so the homepage uses the requested global Meta Title/Description.

Align the initial HTML `<title>` with the new global Meta Title ("H★S Online Earn Platform | Md. Habibur Rahman") so first paint and crawlers see consistent global branding before the React SEO updates run.

requirements.summary: Ensure search engine indexing is allowed (no noindex) and add an explicit robots meta tag allowing indexing.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/robots.txt` continues to allow crawling (User-agent: * / Allow: /) and references `/sitemap.xml`.
There is no `meta name="robots" content="noindex"` (or equivalent) being injected by the app at runtime.

The HTML entry (`frontend/index.html`) includes an explicit robots meta tag that allows indexing (e.g., `index,follow`) OR the build verifies that indexing is allowed without it (no noindex present anywhere).

file_operations.description: Add an explicit `<meta name="robots" ...>` directive that allows indexing (e.g., `index,follow`) to ensure the app is configured to be indexable and does not ship with any noindex directives.
Ensure the runtime SEO layer never injects a `noindex` directive by explicitly setting/updating the robots meta tag to allow indexing (e.g., `index,follow`) alongside other meta tags.
Verify robots.txt continues to allow crawling and references `/sitemap.xml`; make any minimal adjustments needed to keep it compliant with the acceptance criteria.

requirements.summary: Replace visible header brand text with the uploaded logo as the primary header brand on desktop and mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx` renders the header brand as an `` using the uploaded logo asset (the existing `/assets/generated/site-logo-header.dim_512x512.png`), not visible brand text.
The old brand text "MHS Habibur Blog" is not visibly displayed in the header UI (it may remain as screen-reader-only text for accessibility).

The logo has a descriptive English `alt` text aligned with the updated branding (includes "H★S Online Earn Platform" and "Md. Habibur Rahman") and displays with professional sizing/spacing on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Update the header branding to use the existing logo image at `frontend/public/assets/generated/site-logo-header.dim_512x512.png` as the primary visible brand element; remove any visible "MHS Habibur Blog" text (keep SR-only text if desired) and update the image `alt` text to a descriptive English string including "H★S Online Earn Platform" and "Md. Habibur Rahman".
